text: Lineage - and stage - specific expression of <extra_id_0> runt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> box polypeptides in primitive and definitive hematopoiesis .
Translocations involving the human <extra_id_0> CBFA2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> locus have been associated with leukemia .

This gene , originally named <extra_id_0> AML1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , is a human homologue of the Drosophila gene <extra_id_0> runt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> that controls early events in fly embryogenesis .

To clarify the role of mammalian <extra_id_0> runt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> products in normal and leukemic hematopoiesis , we have studied their pattern of expression in mouse hematopoietic tissues in the adult and during ontogeny using an anti-runt box antiserum .
In the adult bone marrow , we found expression of runt polypeptides in differentiating myeloid cells and in B lymphocytes .

Within the erythroid lineage , <extra_id_0> runt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression is biphasic , clearly present in the erythroblasts of early blood islands and of the fetal liver , but absent in the adult .

text: Biochemical analysis by Western blotting of fetal and adult hematopoietic populations shows several runt isoforms .
At least one of them appears to be myeloid specific .
